cfgs.label: Drop Cap
cfgs.description: Display the first letter of the paragraph as a large initial.

cfgs.label: Text Style
cfgs.description: Select a predefined text style, including color, size and font-family.

cfgs.label: Text Color
cfgs.description: Select the text color. If the Background option is selected, styles that don't apply a background image use the primary color instead.

cfgs.label: Show dividers between the text columns
cfgs.description: Choose whether you want to apply a multi-column layout for the text.

cfgs.label: Columns Breakpoint
cfgs.description: Set the device width from which the text columns should apply. Note: For each breakpoint downward the number of columns will be reduced by one.

cfgs.label: Text Alignment
cfgs.description: Center, left and right alignment may depend on a breakpoint and require a fallback.

cfgs.label: Text Alignment Breakpoint
cfgs.description: Define the device width from which the alignment will apply.

cfgs.label: Text Alignment Fallback
cfgs.description: Define an alignment fallback for device widths below the breakpoint.

cfgs.label: Max Width Alignment
cfgs.description: Define the alignment in case the container exceeds the element's max-width.

cfgs.label: Max Width Breakpoint
cfgs.description: Define the device width from which the element's max-width will apply.

cfgs.label: Margin
cfgs.description: Set the vertical margin. Note: The first element's top margin and the last element's bottom margin are always removed. Define those in the grid settings instead.

cfgs.label: Animation
cfgs.description: Override the section's animation setting. This option won't have any effect unless animations are enabled for this section.

cfgs.label: Visibility
cfgs.description: Display the element only on this device width and larger.

cfgs.label: Name
cfgs.description: Define a name to easily indentify this element inside the builder.

cfgs.label: ID
cfgs.description: Define a unique identifier for the element.

cfgs.label: Class
cfgs.description: Define one or more class names for the element. Separate multiple classes with spaces.

cfgs.label: CSS
cfgs.description: Enter your own custom CSS. The following selectors will be prefixed automatically for this element: .el-element
